Line 4: Line 4:      
'''Ethics''', also known as '''moral philosophy''', is a branch of [[philosophy]] that involves systematizing, defending and recommending concepts of right and wrong [[action (philosophy)|conduct]].<ref name="iep.utm.edu">http://www.iep.utm.edu/ethics/</ref> The term comes from the Greek word [[ethos]], which means "character". Ethics is a complement to [[Aesthetics]] in the philosophy field of [[Axiology]]. In philosophy, ethics studies the moral behavior in humans and how one should act.
 
'''Ethics''', also known as '''moral philosophy''', is a branch of [[philosophy]] that involves systematizing, defending and recommending concepts of right and wrong [[action (philosophy)|conduct]].<ref name="iep.utm.edu">http://www.iep.utm.edu/ethics/</ref> The term comes from the Greek word [[ethos]], which means "character". Ethics is a complement to [[Aesthetics]] in the philosophy field of [[Axiology]]. In philosophy, ethics studies the moral behavior in humans and how one should act.
−
Ethics may be divided into four major areas of study:<ref name="iep.utm.edu"/>
+
Ethics may be divided into four major areas of study:<ref name="iep.utm.edu"/> I just wanted to put this at the end to show everyone how easy it is to edit this web site. blah blah blah. there you go
 
* [[Meta-ethics]], about the theoretical meaning and reference of moral propositions and how their [[truth value]]s (if any) may be determined;
 
* [[Meta-ethics]], about the theoretical meaning and reference of moral propositions and how their [[truth value]]s (if any) may be determined;
 
* [[Normative ethics]], about the practical means of determining a moral course of action;
 
* [[Normative ethics]], about the practical means of determining a moral course of action;
